glsa.title: Net::DNS: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Net::DNS Perl module, allowing for a Denial of Service and a cache poisoning attack.

background.p: Net::DNS is a Perl implementation of a DNS resolver.

description.p: hjp discovered an error when handling DNS query IDs which make them partially predictable. Steffen Ullrich discovered an error in the dn_expand() function which could lead to an endless loop.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted DNS request to the server which could result in a Denial of Service with an infinite recursion, or perform a cache poisoning attack.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
